bibl.author: Joseph B. Gilder
bibl.title: Joseph B. Gilder to Walt Whitman, 13 June 1890
bibl.orgName: The Charles E. Feinberg Collection of the Papers of Walt Whitman, 1839-1919, Library of Congress, Washington, DC.

body.p:
Nearly a month ago I sent you a request to vote (as a member of The Critic's Academy of Forty Immortals) for nine successors to the members deceased since our leaders elected the Forty in 1884. I sent a list of about 65 unsuccessful candidates (or rather nominees) who were voted for at that time, + asked you to pick out nine of them or to name nine others if you preferred. Nearly all
the "Academicians" have sent in their votes; but I don't want to announce the result of the thing till I hear from you. If you have lost the printed slip, I can send you another. We shall not tell how any individual voted, but only how they all voted—the net result. I hope you'll not disappoint us.
